intro: Casearia camporum, commonly known as the Brazilian beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Salicaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright blue berries that are edible for birds but toxic to humans. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and showy flower clusters.
